New Records: Los Angeles Dodgers took a 2-0 World Series lead for the first time since 1988
Freddie Freeman homered in four straight Series games dating to Atlanta's last two games against Houston in 2021
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto allowed one hit over 6â…“ innings
Freddie Freeman homered for the second straight night
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernandez also went deep for the Dodgers

Pre-Game Insights: No one said it's going to be easy,It's a long series, and we need to make it a long series now
Los Angeles took a 2-0 Series lead for the first time since 1988
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said 'He had a little left shoulder subluxation. We're going to get some tests at some point tonight or tomorrow, and then we'll know more in the next couple of days'
Freddie Freeman said 'Those six days off were huge for me, between [the] NLCS and the World Series'
Miscellaneous Highlights: New York slugger Aaron Judge went 0 for 4 with three strikeouts and is hitting.150 with six RBIs and 19 strikeouts in 40 postseason at-bats
The Yankees are 0-2 for the first time since 2001
The Dodgers had back-to-back Series homers for just the second time, after Pedro Guerrero and Steve Yeager connected against Yankees lefty Ron Guidry for a 2-1 win in Game 5 in 1981
Others: Yamamoto was sidelined from June 15 to Sept. 10 because of a strained rotator cuff
He improved to 2-0 in four postseason starts
The game is scheduled for Game 3 on Monday at Yankee Stadium
